MainCategory.Description: Technical Proficiency: Assesses the candidate's depth and breadth of technical skills relevant to the software engineer role, including programming languages, frameworks, and tools.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review the candidate's experience with required and preferred technologies mentioned in the job description. Assess their knowledge and experience through technical interview questions, code reviews, and project portfolio analysis.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no experience with required technologies. Lacks fundamental understanding of software engineering principles.
Demonstrates basic understanding and some practical experience with required technologies. Requires guidance and supervision.
Strong understanding and practical experience with required technologies. Can independently design, develop, and test software components.
Expert-level knowledge and extensive experience with required technologies. Can lead technical projects, mentor junior engineers, and contribute to architectural decisions.

MainCategory.Description: Problem Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluates the candidate's ability to analyze complex problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with real-world software engineering problems or case studies. Assess their problem-solving approach, analytical skills, and ability to think critically and creatively.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to analyze complex problems. Unable to identify root causes or propose effective solutions.
Can analyze moderately complex problems with some guidance. Proposes basic solutions with limited creativity.
Effectively analyzes complex problems and identifies root causes. Develops creative and practical solutions.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills. Can solve highly complex problems, develop innovative solutions, and anticipate potential issues.

MainCategory.Description: Communication and Collaboration: Assesses the candidate's ability to communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and clients, and to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's written and verbal communication skills through resume screening and interviews. Assess their ability to work effectively in a team through behavioral questions, role-playing exercises, and reference checks.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor communication skills. Difficulty expressing ideas clearly and concisely. Struggles to collaborate effectively with others.
Adequate communication skills. Can express ideas adequately. Collaborates effectively with others in a structured environment.
Strong communication skills. Expresses ideas clearly and concisely. Collaborates effectively with others in a dynamic environment.
Exceptional communication skills. Can communicate effectively with diverse audiences. Leads collaborative efforts and fosters a positive team environment.

MainCategory.Description: Experience and Qualifications:  Evaluates the candidate's education, years of experience, and relevant work history as they pertain to the job requirements.
MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Verify the candidate's educational background and work experience through resume screening, reference checks, and background checks. Assess the relevance of their experience to the specific requirements of the software engineer role.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Lacks the required education, experience, or certifications for the role.
Meets the minimum education and experience requirements, but lacks relevant experience in key areas.
Meets the education and experience requirements, with significant relevant experience in key areas.
Exceeds the education and experience requirements, with extensive and highly relevant experience in all key areas.

SubCategory.Description: Code Quality and Testing: Assesses the candidate's ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples provided by the candidate. Assess their knowledge of testing methodologies (unit, integration, end-to-end) and their ability to write effective tests. Ask about their experience with code review processes.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is difficult to understand and maintain. Lacks adequate testing.
Code is generally readable and maintainable. Includes some testing, but could be improved.
Code is clean, well-documented, and easy to maintain. Includes comprehensive testing and follows best practices.

SubCategory.Description: System Design: Assesses the candidate's ability to design scalable, reliable, and efficient software systems.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Present the candidate with a system design problem (e.g., designing a URL shortener). Assess their ability to define requirements, choose appropriate technologies, and design a system architecture that meets those requirements.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to define system requirements or propose a viable architecture.
Can define basic system requirements and propose a simple architecture, but lacks depth and consideration for scalability and reliability.
Can define detailed system requirements and design a scalable, reliable, and efficient system architecture.

SubCategory.Description: Adaptability and Learning Agility: Assesses the candidate's willingness and ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing project requirements.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Ask the candidate about their experience learning new technologies. Assess their ability to adapt to new environments and their willingness to take on new challenges.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to learning new technologies or adapting to changing requirements.
Willing to learn new technologies, but requires significant guidance and support.
Enthusiastic about learning new technologies and adapting to changing requirements. Can independently learn new skills and apply them effectively.

SubCategory.Description: Teamwork and Collaboration Skills: Evaluates the candidate's ability to work effectively with other members of the development team.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Use behavioral interview questions and past employment verification to assess the candidates communication skills and ability to positively contribute to a collaborative development environment.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Works poorly in a team setting, does not communicate effectively with coworkers.
Communicates adequately but does not always promote teamwork or collaboration.
Communicates effectively and consistently promotes teamwork.

SubCategory.Description: Customer Focus: Assesses the candidate's dedication to understanding and meeting customer needs.
SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's understanding of the customer's perspective through interview questions. Ask about their experience working with customers and their ability to translate customer needs into technical requirements.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Shows little or no understanding of customer needs.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of customer needs.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of customer needs and a commitment to meeting those needs.
